title: Bi-Weekly Career and Hiring Discussion Thread
selftext:
Hello r/india! If you need any suggestions/help regarding your career, ask here. If your company is hiring or if you are looking for a job, then post here.

**If You or Your Company is Hiring:**

1. Name of the company
2. Location
3. Requirements
4. Preferred way of contacting you

**If You are looking to get hired**

1. Your skillset/experience
2. Portfolio (if any/applicable)
3. Location
4. Preferred way of contacting you

Please do not mention your emails. You can/should prefer to take conversation forward in PMs instead to avoid any privacy mishaps.

Do follow up here with your experience. Did you get a job or hire someone successfully via these threads? Your feedback helps!

**Career Thread is posted every two weeks on Thursday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Career+and+Hiring+thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/osdztmrfx8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=79f0d698e4abf87f45628ddd3057be3fe4b83435
comments: Not sure if this post is right to ask, but I want to know why recruiters in India are so much interested in your current CTC! I mean, pay for the work and skills, ask what is the expected range. I'm completely against this % hike from the last CTC thing!

One of the main reasons is market inequality based on experience. In many firms, especially Finance and Tech, you can have a big salary range for any given level. And you can have varying experience levels working in the same position. 

A Business analyst position can be filled by someone who has 6 years of experience or 4, or even 9. 
Someone coming in with a 4 year experience could be earning much higher or lower than the one with 6 years of experience.

If the pay is based on work/skill then they would either have to pay equally to all of the L2 business analysts. Or they would have fewer people interested because those people would be looking for hike based on their current salary.

You would not work at a company if they are not willing to pay you more than what you earn now. Irrespective of what logic they are using to decide pay rate.

2022 Btech Computer Science   
6 months of internship experience as SDE  
Technologies used: C#, [ASP.NET](https://ASP.NET), MySQL

Technologies I know: HTML, CSS, Java, Python, Data Structures  
Any Location.
